metadata.name: Disable-WindowsOptionalFeature Command PowerShell
metadata.comment: Detect built in PowerShell cmdlet Disable-WindowsOptionalFeature, Deployment Image Servicing and Management tool. Similar to DISM.exe, this cmdlet is used to enumerate, install, uninstall, configure, and update features and packages in Windows images

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM script_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND contains(lower(script.script_content.value), lower('disable-windowsoptionalfeature')) AND contains(lower(script.script_content.value), lower('-online')) AND contains(lower(script.script_content.value), lower('-featurename')) AND (contains(lower(script.script_content.value), lower('windows-defender-gui')) OR contains(lower(script.script_content.value), lower('windows-defender-features')) OR contains(lower(script.script_content.value), lower('windows-defender')) OR contains(lower(script.script_content.value), lower('windows-defender-applicationguard'))))

output.summary: Detect built in PowerShell cmdlet Disable-WindowsOptionalFeature, Deployment Image Servicing and Management tool. Similar to DISM.exe, this cmdlet is used to enumerate, install, uninstall, configure, and update features and packages in Windows images
